title: Monday, 30th July, 2018
bodyHTML:
11:06 am
BE11:07am

Monday, then.

Grouchmonkey Jambo
Dodgson Is this thing on?
Blank canvas good morning everyone
Soundbuy Morgen..............
BE11:07am

We start all over again.

ActiveValue1 Morning all
Grouchmonkey Not much reaction to Foxton results, which seemed pretty dire to me, but what do I know?
BE11:07am

This is Markets Live, FT Alphaville's whatever with etc.

11:08 am
BE11:08am

Where to start? Dunno, it's quiet. Maybe here?

pfd we should note that the vomiting camel is alive and well and last seen in the Economist no less!
BE11:09am

BE11:10am

Tom Cruise, with his unfeasibly thick hairline, clinging from a mountain. You can get an actual review of it here if you wish: https://www.ft.com...-a29d-73e3d454535d

11:10 am
BE11:10am

I only note because I watched it yesterday and was reminded that the agency at the centre of it is called the IMF.

pfd is he climbing the wall of worry?
Soundbuy H&S would be all over Tom..........
Excel Developer @pfd: good one.
BE11:11am

And if you watch it through the lens of Mr Cruise gunning down baddies and crashing helicopters and stuff to foster international trade and global monetary cooperation, it's no less silly.

BE11:12am

Anyway.

11:11 am
undefined
nichoman bit reaction to Clipper, which seemed decent
BE11:12am

What do we have in the way of actual news?

BE11:12am

There's bricks.

11:12 am
Ibstock PLC (IBST:LSE): Last: 249.64, down 28.36 (-10.20%), High: 254.00, Low: 239.20, Volume: 1.77m
Driss theres elon personally delivering m3s
BE11:14am

Shares dropping like a ..... whatever. One-off warning that they've been underinvesting in their factories, that have been running full pelt for a while.

BE11:14am

So there's going to be some downtime while they fix things.

11:14 am
BE11:14am

Knocking about £10m off the consensus, I think.

BE11:15am

Hang on, I don't have to think, someone will tell me. Here's Davy.

BE11:15am

Ibstock has revealed that production in recent months, especially July, has been lower than expected. Hence it has announced that a 12-month period of increased maintenance activity is now planned. The objective of these actions is to ensure the factories can operate at sustainable levels to meet increased demand in the future. The decision follows a review of the group’s brick manufacturing assets that identified a number of required corrective measures. By our reckoning, group maintenance capex over the past five years has averaged just 50% of depreciation, although this percentage has risen in recent years.

Swedes Morning all.
Grouchmonkey New CEO at Ibstock, isn't there? The words "sink" and "kitchen" spring to mind
11:16 am
BE11:16am

As a result of its actions, Ibstock is suggesting that full year adjusted EBITDA will be in a range of £121-125m. This compares to our and the current consensus 2018 forecast of £131m. This is almost 6% lower at the mid-point of the range. Unsurprisingly, the impact will be heavily weighted towards H2. First-half underlying EBITDA is guided at circa £59m, similar to our existing £58m forecast.
The guided adjusted mid-point EBITDA of around £65m for H2 compares with £60m in the second half of 2017 and our prior forecast of £72m for this year. Including the sale of surplus property (a policy previously outlined by Ibstock),
reported EBITDA in 2018 is likely to be in the range of £130-134m. This implies a contribution from property sales of £9m, £8m of which will be in H1.

BE11:17am

And UBS ......

Excel Developer Anyone else stockpiling maroon passports?
BE11:17am

The downgrade is not a reflection of market conditions which remain healthy, driven by an undersupplied brick market in the UK and growth in the new residential housing market. We think there is a possibility that price increases next year can partly recover the shortfall, but for 2018 pricing has already been agreed.

Flaneur So Ibstock are running at full tilt, mortgages are at a '5 month high' yet foxtons is on the floor..... all very confusing....
11:17 am
BE11:18am

Valuation: Buy, 300p price target
While we expect the immediate share price reaction to track the earnings downgrade, we don’t think the issues that have arisen pose structural question marks.

undefined
Grouchmonkey Foxtons=London. Rest of the country going gangbusters.
BE11:18am

@Flaneur: don't be facetious, it's not even slightly confusing.

Ethelred Foxtons fairly London focused I think
Dodgson Foxtons also made 80% of EBITDA from lettings in 2017
11:19 am
BE11:19am

Brickmakers supply newbuild, which is up but still at very low levels because Help To Buy was just QE for CEOs.

Excel Developer Rates going up this week, so not gangbusters for much longer.
1st Lt. Fletcher Christian Morning! Sorry I'm late teacher. Electric gates at the front of my house wouldn't work.
BE11:20am

.... and Foxtons is trapped inside the M25, where prices and transaction volumes are both headed lower. The newbuild market in the capital doesn't even use estate agents, largely.

Pharma @BE "QE for CEOs" - spot on.
BE11:21am

So Foxtons results are exactly as bad as you'd expect.

Ethelred Some big cuts on some London top end stuff as well as reduced volume
pfd not sure base rate makes much difference. Anyone have data to hand on 5 year fixes? have swap rates been edging up?
Pharma @1st Lt. was it a problem in your day-release paperwork?
Excel Developer BofE rate rise a done deal already in the OIS rates https://twitter.com/excel_developer/status/1022257858774220800
11:22 am
Foxtons Group PLC (FOXT:LSE): Last: 51.00, up 3.4 (+7.13%), High: 51.00, Low: 48.80, Volume: 129.60k
BE11:22am

The Foxtons model was always high cost, high leverage.

1st Lt. Fletcher Christian @Pharma - you got me! :)
BE11:22am

So in a shrinking market it gets absolutely smashed.

11:23 am
BE11:23am

Group adjusted EBITDA down to £0.1m from £7.1m

BE11:23am

On a revenue decline down 15% YoY

Swedes How do mortgage approvals for purchase (not remortgage) compare with actual purchase? Would you buy a house during these uncertain Brexit time?
BE11:24am

Outlook meh. Sales recovered to similar levels as last year but still no visibility.

Excel Developer In that there tweet I manage to silence former MPC policymaker Danny Blanchflower. https://twitter.com/excel_developer/status/1022257858774220800
11:24 am
BE11:24am

But lettings slightly better. Positive Q2 and leading into the
seasonally strong Q3,

BE11:24am

Here's Citi.

1st Lt. Fletcher Christian "By our reckoning, group maintenance capex over the past five years has averaged just 50% of depreciation, although this percentage has risen in recent years." - why would you do that when your future is underwritten by HTB?
BE11:25am

Adjusted EBITDA of £0.1m (Citi: £4.2m) displayed a
significant decline versus the prior corresponding period. Adjusted EPS declined to -1.1p (Citi: 0.3p). FCF was -£6m, impacted by the reduced earnings, and net cash ended at £11.9m. We anticipate the negative working capital movement in 1H to unwind in 2H in line with prior periods. The company declared nil dividend.

11:26 am
BE11:26am

Imagine spending £6m to keep Foxtons going. If the option was to pay £6m to shut it down, you could crowdfund among Londoners easily.

Flaneur 'QE for CEOs' - very good. On top of all this theObserver are calling for govt loans for deposits on houses. The mindset behind this is astonishing; it really is a mania. https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/jul/29/housing-renting-mortgages-loans-home-ownership-first-time-buyers?CMP=share_btn_tw
BE11:26am

Transaction volumes declined -23% YoY (Citi: -18%) while
revenue per transaction marginally improved, highlighting Foxtons continued stance on maintaining its premium commission pricing. Lettings revenues decreased -1% to £31.7m as volumes remained flat and average revenue per letting lowered -1% as competition increased. This implies a low single digit 2Q improvement on 1Q18.

Blank canvas Any views on Savills?
BE11:27am

The result comes in weaker than anticipated as we underestimated the negative leverage from the sales business and the level of cost base investment.

Excel Developer @Flaneur: Not the Observer's view, they are reporting a think tank/interest group. Admittedly they perhaps shouldn't.
Flaneur @Ex Dev - I stand corrected.
11:27 am
BE11:27am

While the result showed some improvement from Q1 to Q1 we anticipate ....

BE11:28am

... continued weakness in the share price as there remains limited evidence of a sustainable turnaround in market conditions and a reduction in our full year earnings estimates.

BE11:28am

Our Neutral rating reflects the ongoing market uncertainty and structural challenges.

11:28 am
BE11:28am

And Credit Suisse.

Forester @1st Lt - I read that as criticism of the previous CEO
BE11:29am

Actually, not Credit Suisse. It's boring. Try Jefferies.

1st Lt. Fletcher Christian More trouble for Ibstock is good for me. Forterra is in my portfolio. They also report today, any news there BE?
BE11:29am

Codling's not outright negative.

11:29 am
BE11:29am

The level of housing transactions in the London housing market is subdued and this is reflected in Foxtons' results. However, despite volumes falling, average fees were flat in sales. Turning to lettings, revenue and fees were flat and the group finished the first half with net cash of £11.8m. Foxtons is a fighter: it may be down, but it is not out, and will fight hard in the second half. However, the outlook for the second half remains uncertain and we retain our Hold rating.

Bonnemort Government to land more money to potential house buyers - what could possibly go wrong?
Bonnemort *lend*
BE11:30am

Oh, last note re Foxtons ......

BE11:30am

I note in passing this, from April: https://www.gov.uk...asehold-homeowners

11:30 am
BE11:30am

New crackdown on rogue agents to protect renters and leasehold homeowners
Private rented and leasehold sectors will receive stronger protection from unfair rogue letting and managing agents thanks to new government proposals.

BE11:31am

Now, it's probably just flannel.

Excel Developer @BE: coupled with tax changes, things getting inclement for Lie-To-Bet landlords.

There's certainly no timeline for a new regulator to arrive. But I also note the stitch-up between leasehold and management agents used by lot of estate agents, in London in particular.

1st Lt. Fletcher Christian "Lie-To-Bet" LOL!
11:33 am

Foxtons has rental management, does it have leasehold management? Not sure. Someone can tell me.

undefined

BE11:36am

Here's Numis.

11:36 am
BE11:37am

Forterra’s H1 EBITDA is in line with our estimate and the group states that there are no changes to the Board's full year expectations. Based on this, we leave our 2018 and 2019 PBT forecasts unchanged. Looking forward, we continue to view the supply/demand dynamics in the UK brick industry as attractive, which suggests scope for a positive pricing environment over the medium term. Forterra trades on a 2019 P/E ratio of 10.7x and dividend yield of 3.7%, which we view as attractive. We therefore reiterate our positive recommendation.

BE11:38am

Some forecasts coming down to reflect the weather hit at the start of the year to the bespoke business, but not dramatically.

BE11:38am

Goodbody:

1st Lt. Fletcher Christian Thanks BE - appreciated. I thought they have additional capacity coming on-line. I forget when, I need to check.
11:39 am
BE11:39am

EBITDA was broadly flat at £39.2m in line with our expectations of £39.5m, with the outturn reflecting the well flagged weather and higher input costs, which particularly impacted the Bespoke Division. Given the latter, it is likely that we will be downgrading PBT forecasts by circa £4m to circa £64m (note the latter is the lower bound of consensus).

Group net debt continued to decline from £60.8m at FY17 to £52m and compares to our forecast of £57m, reflecting the strong cash generation of the business. This leaves net debt/EBITDA at 0.7x. This leaves headroom for M&A / investment, notwithstanding the planned Desford expansion project a (£90-95m outlay which is anticipated to be spent from 2019-2022).

undefined
BE11:40am

Pick of the weekend press was probably Thomas Cook.

11:40 am
Thomas Cook Group plc (TCG:LSE): Last: 96.05, up 5.7 (+6.31%), High: 97.70, Low: 90.40, Volume: 4.42m
BE11:40am

https://www.thetim...ine-sale-xzkwhh2n3

BE11:41am

John Collingridge, who seems to write two-thirds of the ST business section these days, reports that Thomas Cook looking at how to hive off its airline.

nichoman Clipper Logistics?
11:42 am
BE11:42am

Company's denial of sorts - "We have no current plans to sell our airline" - suggests it's early stage rather than wrong.

BE11:43am

Question is, who'd buy it?

BE11:43am

Couple of pars from Bernstein.

11:43 am
BE11:43am

Thomas Cook's airline is having to compete, on a short haul front, with a rapidly expanding Ryanair & easyJet. It has increasingly focussed on long haul, but here too competition is expanding quickly (Norwegian, Virgin Atlantic). Its tour operator has handled the shift from high street booking to online well, but faces competition from lower cost online only players: OnTheBeach, Love Holidays; and from a resurgent Jet2 & TUI. More management focus might aid the fight.

Shinshin @BE wouldn't it be the usual 'buy for slots, worry about the planes later' ? And the planes will all be leased anyway.
BE11:45am

Main stumbling block: who will buy it?

BE11:45am

With yields under pressure from high supply growth and with the recent collapses ....

11:45 am
BE11:45am

.... of Air Berlin and Monarch, buyers will be limited.

BE11:46am

The Sunday Times report suggests Fosun (12% stake in TCG) could buy a separate stake in the airline, but presumably only if it is cheaper than increasing the stake in TCG.

BE11:46am

Thomas Cook Q3 tomorrow.

11:46 am
BE11:46am

Come down pretty far on the idea of the hot summer and World Cup combining to cut the late bookings.

As we wrote back here: https://www.ft.com...-a29d-73e3d454535d

BE11:47am

About a quarter of holidays are lates/last minute bookings. Though the season runs to the end of September I think so that's quite a big window.

Earnings worse, debt worse, guidance worse.

Soundbuy Hmmm,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,floated 2014............
BE11:53am

While the contract pipeline is fine, retail sector grimness has led management to taking a more realistic/pessimistic view over the conversion rates.

BE11:54am

Because, I guess, if your prospective customer's just done a CVA it won't want that logistics and e-fulfilment solution you've just flogged them.

11:54 am
BE11:54am

Let me see if anyone covers.

BE11:55am

Not really. Nick Bubb has a par.

BE11:55am

The logistics company Clipper hit the headlines at the end of April by winning the prized contract to run the new Sheffield distribution warehouse for Boohoo’s fast-growing subsidiary Pretty Little Thing, but since then the share price has drifted back quite a long way (the market cap is down to £410m), as if logistics isn’t simply a licence to print money…So we had a look at today’s final results for y/e April to see if Clipper is “clipping” along. And PBT is up 15% to £14.3m, on the back of 18% revenue growth to £400m, but you have to wonder why the business isn’t growing faster, given that it trumpets that it “commenced significant new contracts with high profile retailers including Edinburgh Woollen Mill, River Island, M&S and ASOS” and saw “significant growth in activity with many of our customers including Asda, Morrisons, Philip Morris, Wilko and s.Oliver”.

BitcoinBasher Hey, what does everyone think of this bitcoin thing?
11:56 am
BE11:56am

I think N+1 Singer also cover, but they don't send us their stuff any more. So ..... speak to them directly, I guess.

undefined
1st Lt. Fletcher Christian Bitcoin is a game for morons. Underlying tech is useful.
Swedes Fencer 🐪
BE11:57am

What to wrap up? There's GVC

Excel Developer @swedes: is that a vomiting camel?

BE11:58am

(@Swedes: I don't know how you did that but I'm very impressed.)

Excel Developer @BE: I can do that but you threatened to ban me!
1st Lt. Fletcher Christian Is the hump the Bitcoin graph?
Excel Developer double standards @BE
GVC Holdings PLC (GVC:LSE): Last: 1,150, up 54.97 (+5.02%), High: 1,178, Low: 1,146, Volume: 2.66m
Swedes BE 🤮🐫
Pharma (ah, did other people see something other than a square? On a Mac here)
BE11:59am

...... the weird unregulated gambling markets rollup that achieved exit velocity and now owns Ladbrokes, absurdly.

Excel Developer cheap unicode trick @Swedes
12:00 pm
BE12:00pm

Announces a JV today with MGM, the most tasteful of the Vegas Strip casinos. They both kick in $100m.

1st Lt. Fletcher Christian What is wrong with the odd emoji? Adds colour.
BE12:01pm

I'm a wee bit unclear what the JV's actually for other than co-branding websites and split lawyers' fees. But as investors have been burnt many many times on US gambling expansion there's not much in the valuation anyway.

1st Lt. Fletcher Christian @Fancer - Seriously though, I would stay clear of Bitcoin if I were you. It isn't even a decent currency because it isn't stable enough.
BE12:02pm

Here's Canaccord.

chad_john anything on Frontier quickly? It's been in freefall as of late
12:02 pm
BE12:02pm

The deal will give GVC access to 15 US states (where MGM and Boyd Gaming are licensed casino operators). Significantly, it gets access to MGM's database of 27m reward scheme customers. And it creates a partnership with one of the biggest brands in US gambling, ahead of the opening up of the US sports betting market following the Supreme Court decision to overturn PASPA (the law which prevented most US states from offering sports betting).

1st Lt. Fletcher Christian Sorry @Fencer
A. M. (@Pharma: a vomiting emoji followed by one of a camel)
BE12:03pm

GVC had already partnered with MGM/Borgata in New Jersey, so this is a logical progression. It creates an exclusive partnership, with each partner committing to $100m investment in the JV, mostly covering marketing spend. It will operate under both the playMGM and partypoker brands. The JV plans to go live in existing legal markets (i.e. Nevada) by the start of the American football season (October), and will aim to roll out in newly regulated states in due course. GVC will supply platform technology and sportsbook/Gaming content; MGM provides its existing US sportsbook operations, its licenses (and market access agreement with Boyd) and its customer lists.

BE12:03pm

GVC CEO Kenny Alexander promised a "big and bold" strategy to exploit the US sports betting opportunity, and this partnership undoubtedly fits the bill. The JV structure provides access to the MGM brand, customers and regulatory infrastructure, which should be invaluable in building a strong position in the nascent market.

12:03 pm
BE12:03pm

The scale of the opportunity is hard to gauge - given lack of clarity over tax structures, product offerings (i.e. some states could be land-based only, some could prohibit in-play, restrict licences, etc.), number of states and speed of roll-out.

wayneJ @Chad - frontier - waiting for the next game announcement but management have made clear that they will announce it nearer launch so a degree of radio silence
BE12:04pm

But it is not over-exuberant to suggest it can become a $10bn GGR market. GVC can tap into a 27m customer database [FanDuel, by comparison, boasts 7m registered customers] - not all will be interested in sports betting, but there will be material overlap.

BE12:04pm

And it has access to a strong US domestic brand. The $200m investment commitment from GVC/MGM is not a cap, but is a demonstration of commitment. And Mr Alexander said that GVC would have "failed miserably" if the JV did not emerge as the market leader in US sports betting.

wayneJ Also mkt failing to appreciate traction of Jurassic Park franchise - will work independent of the film. And the backing of Tencent is under-estimated
chad_john thx Wayne, it's off nearly 50% from the highs though, seems a bit too severe
12:04 pm
BE12:04pm

Ahead of the announcement, GVC's shares were already up 24% YTD, and look well set for further outperformance. The recent trading update demonstrated continuing premium organic revenue growth (20% constant currency online revenue growth in its H1) and we continue to see upside to the group's £130m synergy target from integrating Ladbrokes Coral. It now looks to be optimally positioned to grow into what will be the world's biggest online sports betting market. Given clear option value around the US, we raise our TP from 1250p to 1375p, putting the shares on a 13.0x FY20 EV/Ebitda, a modest discount to fellow FTSE100 Online Gaming company Paddy Power Betfair, to reflect execution risk from the Ladbrokes deal. We stick at BUY.

undefined
Excel Developer @waynej: what do ya think of Disney are they blowing it on Star Wars franchise?
BE12:06pm

On Frontier, I bow to @WayneJ's superior knowledge on this one.

12:06 pm
Frontier Developments PLC (FDEV:LSE): Last: 1,110, down 45 (-3.90%), High: 1,200, Low: 1,110, Volume: 40.35k
chad_john thx BE
Pharma @A.M. ta. Now I feel marginalised. Perhaps Mac users should get some protection against discrimination.
BE12:06pm

There was a pretty good Jefferies note around last week.

wayneJ Agreed. Also the last statement made clear that they also were outsourcing some games development to other studios. Think that is interesting as people are missing that they bought a lot of IP from Atari (including games that they had themselves developed)
alewis2005 @wayneJ is that why people were painting a huge dinosaur claw by Old St roundabout this morning?
1st Lt. Fletcher Christian Thanks BE/ROTR - have a good afternoon everyone.
wayneJ Disney - the Star Wars franchise which was lovingly nutured is now in danger of over -exploitation but frankly every film helps Elite
Grouchmonkey @pharma I use Mac and received the vomiting camel loud and clear on safari. Are you using another browser?
BE12:07pm

They were buyers on the idea that Frontier can double its AAA franchises and go from the current two-year earnings hump to a smoother annual earnings type pattern.

Excel Developer 🐨
Soundbuy Animal Magic.........
12:08 pm
BE12:08pm

Course, that takes a lot of trust in David Braben not delivering a very expensive clunker or rushing out something barely finished to keep shareholders happy.

Excel Developer 🐫 sorry typo
BE12:09pm

Eidos-itis, I think it's called.

wayneJ The problem with games companies is that investors like smooth predictable earnings but what really makes money is the one off blockbuster. So you have to select the stable that has a track record. And bizarrely Frontier - due to its long history of development - has a track record in game development second to none but never (due to lack of money) had the economics.
BE12:09pm

We did the Jefferies note in summary here: https://www.ft.com...-b639-7680cedcc421

wayneJ The UK is obsessed with Eidos / Laura Croft. Much better examples are things like Witcher and Fortnite.
alewis2005 @wayneJ I thought the UK was obsessed with GTA as our flagship home-grown blockbuster?
wayneJ And remember that Tencent - a shareholder in Frontier - has a serious track record of selecting winners - but also has the capability of being a king maker - ie getting access to the Chinese market.
12:11 pm
BE12:11pm

Guess you also have, with Codemasters and Team17, other options even in the UK market for middle-aged fund managers to come back from long lunches and say "we need to get onto this video gaming thing right now, I hear the kids are all on their Colecovisions these days"

wayneJ @alewis - most of Team UK have no idea about GTA! (Or Runescape etc)
BE12:12pm

Okay, I'll stop waffling and you'll stop looking for emojis.

alewis2005 ugh Jagex attempted to hire from my uni v heavily back when I was graduating
BE12:13pm

Thanks for joining. Ta for the comments, and hope your Monday is splendid.

12:13 pm
BE12:13pm

Afternoon all.

Excel Developer bye
wayneJ Think the sentiment for the games market is also set by Electronic Arts which is trying to do to computer games what Disney is doing to Star Wars :-)
Provender JWE had great twitch coverage from big name streamers for first couple of weeks but not much in the way of legs. Made top 5 Steam sales though I think
Blank canvas thanks
